name: ALICE
text:
Systems online...
Initializing ALICE...
Welcome, operative. I’ve been expecting you.

name: ALICE
text:
I am ALICE.
Advanced Logic Interface for Cybernetic Engagement.

name: ALICE
text: Today, you will learn how to identify phishing emails.

name: ALICE
text:
Tip 1:
Inspect the 'From' address carefully.
Example: An email claims to be from 'PayPal', but the sender is 'support@paypall.com'.
That extra 'l' means it’s fake.

name: ALICE
text:
Tip 2:
Watch for urgent or threatening language.
Example: 'Your account will be closed in 24 hours!' — Scammers use panic to push mistakes.

name: ALICE
text:
Tip 3:
Look for spelling and grammar mistakes.
Example: 'Dear Custumer, your accont is blockd.' — Professional companies rarely make such errors.

name: ALICE
text:
Tip 4:
Hover over links to reveal their true destination.
Example: The text says 'www.bank.com', but hovering shows 'http://malicious-site.ru'.

name: ALICE
text:
Tip 5:
Avoid downloading unexpected attachments.
Example: A 'Receipt.pdf' from an unknown sender could actually be a virus.

name: ALICE
text:
Tip 6:
Beware of generic greetings like 'Dear customer'.
Example: If your bank knows you, they’ll use your full name.

name: ALICE
text:
Tip 7:
Check for mismatched branding.
Example: The logo looks blurry and colors seem off — a sign it’s a copied image.

name: ALICE
text:
Tip 8:
Don’t trust requests for sensitive info via email.
Example: 'Confirm your password here' — legitimate companies don’t ask this.

name: ALICE
text:
Tip 9:
Cross-check suspicious messages.
Example: If you get a delivery email you didn’t request, check the courier’s official site instead.

name: ALICE
text:
Tip 10:
Trust your instincts.
Example: If the email feels wrong, it’s safer to delete it than to take the risk.

name: ALICE
text:
You will now receive a series of emails.
Some will be safe. Some will be dangerous.

name: ALICE
text: Read each carefully. Decide if it is legitimate or a phishing attempt.

name: ALICE
text: If you make a mistake, I will provide a short tip so you can learn.

name: ALICE
text: Remember: In cyberspace, trust nothing without verification.

name: ALICE
text:
Now... let's begin the training.
Press the CLOSE button when you are ready
